subject: Re: junit and HPQC
msgSnippet: From the HP Website, http://h20229.www2.hp.com/partner/isv/Arsin_prod1.jsp I found that Effecta Integration Framework by Arsin Corporation may be used for
messageBody:
From the HP Website, http://h20229.www2.hp.com/partner/isv/Arsin_prod1.jsp

I found that Effecta Integration Framework by Arsin Corporation may be used for JUNIT integration.

Unfortunaly, I am not able to find any documentation which tells me how to achieve this?

Any pointers?

Regards
Gaurav Pandey
www.WhatIsTesting.com

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Gaurav Pandey" <gaurav_dell@...> wrote:
>
> Hi
>
> I am a software tester with no experience with JUnit however, I think I know my way around HPQC.
>
> For one of the projects, the development team is using JUnit to prepare test cases, however as a process, I have been asked to find out if JUnit and HPQC are compatible.
>
> I would request any suggestions/pointers/Challenges/best practices which would assist me in understanding the compatibility.
>
> I also have some questions which I was not able to figure out?
>
> 1. Is JUnit a unit testing tool? or is it a testing management tool in which we store test cases and test execution results
> 2. I have download Junit from the http://www.junit.org/, however I have not been able to "load" the tool. I am not sure on which file to execute? I am running on Windows XP SP2.
>
> I understand that these might be newbie questions, however any pointers you might provide me would be very appericated
>
